classes.cCustomNote: Choose one of the following: ANT201; GEOG150; HIST110, HIST111, HIST222, or HIST223; SOC110.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, Lower-Division F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). No POLS class may be taken to fulfill Upper-Division D. Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.
Choose one of the following: Any 200- or 300- level ES or WGS course.

Any POLS Major Course (300-400 Level Elective) can go here.

A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward upper-division Political Science electives. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count towards the concentration. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward Free Electives. Any combination of POLS386 and POLS387 may be taken for a maximum of 12 units total credit for the degree.

Select one of the following: BUS207, BUS409, BUS410; CRP/NR 404, CRP/NR 408; CRP420; ES380; JOUR302; LS214; PHIL334; POLS295, POLS340, POLS342, POLS384, POLS386 or POLS387 (4 units max), POLS417, POLS426, POLS445, POLS457; PSY375; SOC402, SOC406, SOC412.

A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward upper-division Political Science electives. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count towards the concentration. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward Free Electives. Any combination of POLS386 and POLS387 may be taken for a maximum of 12 units total credit for the degree.

Consultation with a faculty advisor is recommended prior to selecting Approved Electives; bear in mind your selections may impact the pursuit of post-baccalaureate studies and/or goals.
